Yes! Istanbul is a big city with a lot of traffic, so getting around can sometimes be challenging. However, there are several modes of transportation that you can use to navigate the city and see the historical sites. Here are a few recommendations:

1. Public transportation: Istanbul has an extensive public transportation network, with buses, trams, ferries, and a metro system. You can purchase an Istanbulkart, a rechargeable travel card, and use it to pay for all modes of transportation. This is an excellent option for budget-conscious travelers and those who want to avoid the hassle of navigating Istanbul's traffic. 2. Taxi/Uber: Taxis are widely available in Istanbul and are relatively inexpensive compared to other major cities. You can also use Uber or similar ride-hailing services to get around. However, keep in mind that traffic can be heavy, especially during rush hour. 3. Walking: Walking is an excellent option for exploring the historical sites in Istanbul, especially if they are located close together. It's also a great way to experience the city's vibrant culture and street life. 4. Guided tours: If you're not familiar with the city and its transportation system, a guided tour might be the best option. Many tours include transportation to and from the landmarks, and you can sit back and relax while someone else does the driving. I hope these tips are helpful!
